title: Asian American workers could be the most heavily affected by AI
description: As the world prepares for a new era of artificial intelligence, a recently released study says that two groups stand to be uniquely affected: Asian Americans and women.

title: Ron DeSantis’ Key West anti-migrant missions raised pilot safety concerns
description: The law enforcement commissioner, appointed by Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis, waived rules about which planes could be used and how far they could go from land, documents show.

title: Twitch influencer Kai Cenat in custody after console giveaway causes chaos at New York City park
description: A video game influencer was in custody after a giveaway in a New York City park erupted in chaos on Friday, authorities said.

title: New coup plot details fuel fears Germany’s far right is getting more extreme as it gains support
description: New details about the Reichsburger coup plot in Germany this week add to growing fears about the fa-right AfD party getting more extreme as it gains support.

title: Instagram and Facebook are blocking news in Canada, creating a 'news desert'
description: Over the next few weeks, Meta will begin to block people in Canada from viewing or posting news links and audiovisual news content on Instagram and Facebook.

title: Hackers force hospital system to take its national computer system offline
description: Sixteen hospitals and more than a hundred other medical facilities across the United States are offline after the largest cyberattack on a U.S. hospital system since last year.

title: The ‘Flu Shot Cheerleader’ is back — with a warning about the anti-vaccine movement
description: In 2009, Desiree Jennings went viral for saying a flu shot triggered her mysterious illness. Now she has a warning about the anti-vaccine movement.

title: Parkland mass shooting will be re-enacted at the school using up to 139 live bullets as part of lawsuit
description: A court-ordered re-enactment of the 2018 Parkland, Florida, mass shooting, which left 17 dead, will occur Friday inside Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School today, officials said.

title: Mark Margolis, actor known for 'Breaking Bad' and 'Better Call Saul,' dies at 83
description: Mark Margolis, a journeyman actor best known for playing a wild-eyed drug lord on the AMC shows "Breaking Bad" and "Better Call Saul," died.

title: Does Trump have any legal defenses against the special counsel's charges? Here are four
description: Experts say Trump can raise a number of plausible legal defenses against federal charges that he conspired to defraud the U.S. with bogus claims of election fraud, obstruct Congress in its counting of electoral votes, and deprive Americans of their rights.

title: This couple had 4 Disney weddings. Now, they’re planning 2 more.
description: Shellie has gone viral online for having repeat Disney weddings with her husband. After four ceremonies, the couple is planning two more, despite the cost.

title: Armen Adamjan shares hacks for around the house this summer
description: TikTok star Armen Adamjan joins Hoda & Jenna with hacks to help around the house, including easy ways to shuck corn, cut watermelon, turning on electronics when you don’t have the right batteries and more.

title: Job market slows as the number of people looking for work accelerates
description: Rudy Tomarchio has been looking for a job for three months — and says time is running out before he'll deplete his savings.

title: Police expected to identify another victim in Gilgo Beach killings, source says
description: Police are expected to identify another victim in the notorious Gilgo Beach killings Friday, a senior law enforcement source told NBC New York.

title: Florida effectively bans AP psychology and debate over kids' internet use: Morning Rundown
description: Trump arraignment, Bryan Kohberger alibi, Texas A&M settlement, Oregon kidnapping, Russian warship attacked, Ukraine sea drones, Florida AP Psychology

title: Phony bank accounts resurface at Wells Fargo, with a twist
description: More than 40 consumers have reported mysterious accounts opened in their names at Wells Fargo. One man says someone opened an account in his name and deposited thousands of dollars.

title: Russian warship appears damaged in Ukrainian sea drone attack on navy base
description: Russia said Friday that Ukraine had attacked the Black Sea port of Novorossiysk using naval drones, with the Olenegorsky Gornyak warship apparently damaged.

title: Tennessee Democrats expelled by GOP over protests win back their seats
description: Republican legislators expelled Justin Jones and Justin J. Pearson in unprecedented state House votes, drawing national attention and accusations of racism.

title: An 87-year-old woman fought off an intruder, then fed him after he told her he was hungry
description: An 87-year-old Maine woman ably fought off a teenage attacker, then fed him because he said he was “awfully hungry.”

title: Federal appeals court allows Biden asylum restrictions to stay in place
description: The new rule makes it extremely difficult for people to be granted asylum unless they first seek protection in a country they’re traveling through on their way to the U.S. or apply online.

title: Man accused of holding woman captive in Oregon cell allegedly threatened to kill the mother of his 2 children
description: A man who officials say kidnapped and held a woman captive in a makeshift cell in his Oregon garage allegedly attacked, abused and threatened to kill another woman and their two children before she sought a protective order against him three years ago.
